events.title: ALEX ELLE & LIBBY DELANA — JOY IN ACTION
events.description: Advice from wellness instructors on how to seek and track joy in the New Year and throughout 2026.

events.title: ROBERT M. DOWLING — COYOTE: THE DRAMATIC LIVES OF SAM SHEPARD
events.description: Shepard, the Bob Dylan of American Drama, had an almost unbelievably eventful life.

events.title: FRANK VAN RIPER & JUDITH GOODMAN — THE GREEN HEART OF ITALY
events.description: A beautiful photographic journey through the heart of Italy.

events.title: NATHANIEL PHILBRICK — TRAVELS WITH GEORGE
events.description: Following George Washington's journey as the first president.

events.title: J. RYAN STRADAL — THE LAGER QUEEN OF MINNESOTA
events.description: A novel about family, beer, and ambition in Minnesota.

events.title: SARAH VOWELL — THE WORDY SHIPMATES
events.description: Sarah Vowell's witty and hilarious take on the Puritans.

events.title: COLSON WHITEHEAD — CROOK MANIFESTO
events.description: The second book in Whitehead's Harlem trilogy.

events.title: ELIZABETH KOLBERT — THE SIXTH EXTINCTION
events.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning book on mass extinction.

events.title: RON CHERNOW — ALEXANDER HAMILTON
events.description: The biography that inspired the Broadway musical.

events.title: JESMYN WARD — SING, UNBURIED, SING
events.description: A powerful novel set in rural Mississippi.

events.title: MICHAEL LEWIS — THE UNDOING PROJECT
events.description: The story of Daniel Kahneman and Amos Tversky.

events.title: RACHEL KUSHNER — THE MARS ROOM
events.description: A novel about a woman serving two life sentences in prison.

events.title: Karl Ove Knausgaard: The School of Night
events.description: Karl Ove Knausgaard discusses his new novel 'The School of Night' in conversation with Tope Folarin. Livestream available.

events.title: Gayle Feldman: Nothing Random - Bennett Cerf Biography
events.description: Gayle Feldman discusses 'Nothing Random: Bennett Cerf and the Publishing House He Built' with Kitty Kelley. The book tells the story of the legendary Random House founder.

events.title: GAYLE FELDMAN — NOTHING RANDOM: BENNETT CERF
events.description: The biography of the Random House founder.

events.title: JENNIFER EGAN — THE CANDY HOUSE
events.description: The sibling novel to A Visit from the Goon Squad.

events.title: DAVID GRANN — THE WAGER
events.description: A tale of shipwreck, mutiny, and murder.

events.title: W. RALPH EUBANKS — WHEN IT'S DARKNESS ON THE DELTA
events.description: A new look at the roots of American inequality.

events.title: ANDREW BURSTEIN — BEING THOMAS JEFFERSON
events.description: An intimate history of Thomas Jefferson.

events.title: Author Events at Politics and Prose
events.description: Politics and Prose hosts hundreds of author readings, book signings, and discussions each year. Check their website for the current schedule.
events.history_note: Since opening in 1984, Politics and Prose has hosted every major American author from Toni Morrison to Barack Obama. The bookstore's events have become a key stop on national book tours.

events.title: JONATHAN EISEN — MICROBES RULE THE WORLD
events.description: How microorganisms shape our planet.

events.title: Teen Scene @ Tenley
events.description: Weekly program for teen patrons with rotating activities including video games, origami, crafts, and special presenters.

events.title: CONVERSATIONS WITH BOOKSELLERS — NURTURING HOPE
events.description: Join booksellers as we share our thoughts on books for youth.

events.title: RACHEL ELIZA GRIFFITHS — THE FLOWER BEARERS
events.description: A moving memoir about family and loss.

events.location: Politics and Prose at The Wharf
events.title: DR. ASHLEY ALKER — 99 WAYS TO DIE
events.description: A doctor's guide to dangerous situations.

events.title: Children's Storytime at Tenley-Friendship Library
events.description: Free storytime for children ages 0-5 with songs, fingerplays, and picture books. A wonderful introduction to the library.
events.history_note: The Tenley-Friendship library branch opened in 1928, serving the community for nearly a century. The current building dates to 2010, replacing the original structure.

events.title: Gentle Yoga with Beth Lawrence
events.description: Gentle yoga for adults of all ages in Meeting Room 1. Free and open to the public.

events.title: Tenley Movie Night: Into the Woods
events.description: Evening film screening of 'Into the Woods' (2014), rated PG. Free admission.

events.title: DOROTHY A. BROWN — GETTING TO REPARATIONS
events.description: How building a new economy can address racial injustice.

events.title: Friends of Tenley Library Book Sale
events.description: Shop a range of donated titles with proceeds supporting the library. Located in the Friends' space on the 2nd floor. Cash only.

events.title: MARGARET ATWOOD — OLD BABES IN THE WOOD
events.description: New stories from the master of speculative fiction.

events.title: English Conversation Group
events.description: ESL conversation circle led by professional interpreter Carol Ruppel. Best for intermediate level and above English learners.

events.title: ANTHONY DOERR — CLOUD CUCKOO LAND
events.description: An epic novel spanning centuries.

events.title: VIET THANH NGUYEN — A MAN OF TWO FACES
events.description: A memoir about being Vietnamese-American.

events.title: ELIN HILDERBRAND — THE HOTEL NANTUCKET
events.description: A summer novel set in Nantucket.

events.title: BONNIE GARMUS — LESSONS IN CHEMISTRY
events.description: A novel about a 1960s chemist who becomes a TV cooking show host.

events.title: JASON REYNOLDS — LONG WAY DOWN
events.description: A powerful novel in verse about gun violence.

events.title: AMOR TOWLES — TABLE FOR TWO
events.description: New stories from the author of A Gentleman in Moscow.

events.title: ROBERT CARO — WORKING
events.description: The legendary biographer discusses his craft.

events.title: KRISTIN HANNAH — THE GREAT ALONE
events.description: A novel set in the wilds of Alaska.

events.title: Ward 3 Democrats Monthly Meeting
events.description: Monthly meeting of the Ward 3 Democratic Committee featuring guest speakers, local issues discussion, and community organizing.
events.history_note: Ward 3 has been a politically active community since DC gained home rule in 1973. The ward has produced several DC Council members and remains highly engaged in local politics.

events.title: AU Park Neighbors Meeting
events.recurrence_pattern: Third Wednesday of March, June, September, December
events.description: Quarterly meeting of AU Park residents to discuss neighborhood issues, development projects, and community concerns.
events.history_note: AU Park developed in the 1920s-30s and residents have organized to protect the neighborhood character ever since. The current civic association dates to the 1950s.

events.title: Tenleytown Farmers Market
events.description: Fresh produce, baked goods, local honey, and artisan products from regional farmers and producers. A neighborhood gathering spot on Saturday mornings.
events.history_note: Farmers markets have a long history in the Tenleytown area. Before the neighborhood developed, this land was farmland supplying Georgetown and Washington markets.

events.title: American University Spring Commencement
events.description: American University's spring graduation ceremony celebrates degree recipients from all schools and colleges.
events.history_note: American University held its first commencement in 1916, just two years after opening. The ceremony has grown from a handful of graduates to thousands each year.

events.title: Fort Reno Summer Concert Series
events.recurrence_pattern: Every Monday and Thursday in July and August
events.description: Free outdoor concerts featuring local and touring bands. Bring a blanket and picnic to the highest point in DC for an evening of live music under the stars.
events.history_note: The Fort Reno concerts began in 1968 and became famous for launching DC punk and indie bands in the 1980s and 1990s. Bands like Fugazi and Jawbox played here before becoming nationally known. The tradition continues with a mix of established and emerging artists.

events.title: Friendship Heights Holiday Festival
events.address: 4433 South Park Ave, Chevy Chase, MD
events.description: Annual holiday celebration with tree lighting, carolers, Santa visits, and refreshments. A beloved neighborhood tradition.
events.history_note: The Friendship Heights community has celebrated the holidays together since the neighborhood developed in the 1920s. The current festival format dates to the 1970s.
